div.ab:
بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم وصلّى اللّه على
سپدپا والحمد محمد للّه
الّذي أعلم به الأخ العزيز الموفّق
السّعيد المحترم الأمين أبي إسحاق
إبراهيم وفّقه اللّه تعالي وسوى دلكا
يا مولاي أنّي قد سيّرت الحمل وتلــك
إليك إذا وصل يوسف ريّس البحارالتّجّار
فسلّم له الحمل فتسلّمه له وصوله
ما بين الفقيه أو ما بين عبد الرّحيم أعلم
المولا ذلك وتأخذ له الطّوريّة
ما يحتاج المولا وصيّة وصيّة وبالمولا صريــح
ذلك وأنا منتضر وصولك إن
كنت تجي تقضي حوايجك أعلمك
ذلك والسّلام وكاتب هذه
حرف يحيى وهو يسلّم علي المولا
وعلى أهل بيته والسّلام وصلّى
اللّه على عبده والحمد للّه وحده

In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate. God bless
our Lord Muḥammad.‭
That which I [am writing to] inform the dear brother, the successful,
auspicious, respectable, and trustworthy Abū Isḥāq
Ibrāhīm - may God, the Most High, make him successful! - and so forth. [Now, to the topic:] Ibrāhīm - may God, the Most High, make him successful! - as follows(?):
O my master, I have sent a large shipment to
your care. If Yūsuf, the chief merchant, arrives, your care. If Yūsuf, the head of the [Kārimī?] merchants, arrives,
please hand the load over to him. [Also,] please hand over to him [upon] his arrival, please hand the load to him. [Also,] please hand over to him, upon his arrival,
whatever is between the jurist and ʿAbd al-Raḥīm [regarding the debt?]. I am reporting whatever is between the jurist and ʿAbd al-Raḥīm [regarding the unfinished business]. I am reporting
to [you,] the master, about this matter. And you will [also] receive the mattock intended for him. to [you,] the Master, about this matter. You ought [also] to receive the mattocks on his behalf.
Du brauchst ja (sicherlich) keine Ermahung ... Whatever should [you,] the Master need, please entrust it [to me]. And it has been made clear to [you,] the Master,
regarding this. And in the meantime, I am looking forward to your arrival if
you choose to come to take care of your business. Hereinabove is my report to you.
Greetings. The writer of these
lines salutes and greets you, the master, lines salutes and greets [you,] the Master,
and his (i.e. your) family members. God bless
His servant. Praise be to God alone.
